item.description: Nicholas Ollberding is a quantitative epidemiologist with applied research interests investigating the role of diet in the etiology and progression of chronic disease and the role of the developing infant intestinal microbiome on growth and early development. Areas of methodical research interest include the development and application of analytical methods for microbial metagenomic next-generation sequence data and dietary assessment and analysis methodology. He also collaborates broadly as a quantitative methodologist and statistician in the area of health sciences research and leads the Biostatistics Core of the Heart Institute Research Core at Cincinnati Childrenâ€™s Hospital Medical Center.
